#modify tag usage.


== Modifies an DOM object == 
<div id="modifyTest">SOMETHING TO MODIFY</div>

<modify object="modifyTest" get="innerHTML" set="I AM MODIFED!" /> 
<modify object="modifyTest" get="style" set="background-color:#0066CC;border:dotted;" />

<br />

CHANGE CSS CLASS USING MODIFY TAG.

<style type="text/css"> 
.myCss {     
background-color:#0066FF;     
width:200px;     
height:30px;
padding:30;     
}
<br>
.newStyle{
background-color:#000000;     
width:200px;     
height:30px;
padding:30; 
} 
</style>
<div id="someDiv" class="myCss">
change class using modify tag.
</div>

<modify object="someDiv" get="class" set="newStyle" />
<br>
* Using modify to change css class with an event *
<input type="button" name="btnModify" value="Modify!" onclick="modify(this, 'click')" />
<modify object="someDiv" get="class" set="newStyle" on="btnModify.click" />
